block.p: Alexandra Ascher, the daughter of Renee and Arthur H. Ascher of Manhattan, is to be married today to David Parnis Hochman, the son of Carole S. Hochman of Manhattan and Neal S. Hochman of Jupiter, Fla. Rabbi David H. Lincoln is to officiate at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx.

The bride, 24, recently completed her second year at the Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law of Yeshiva University in Manhattan, where she is a coordinator of Cardozo Advocates for Battered Women. This summer, she is to be a law intern in the Manhattan abuse and neglect division of the New York City Administration for Children's Services. Her father owns North American Graphics, a printing business in Manhattan. Her mother is the chairwoman of Dorot, a New York City charity that provides social services to elderly people.

Alexandra Ascher, the daughter of Renee and Arthur H. Ascher of Manhattan, is to be married today to David Parnis Hochman, the son of Carole S. Hochman of Manhattan and Neal S. Hochman of Jupiter, Fla. Rabbi David H. Lincoln is to officiate at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx.

The bride, 24, recently completed her second year at the Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law of Yeshiva University in Manhattan, where she is a coordinator of Cardozo Advocates for Battered Women. This summer, she is to be a law intern in the Manhattan abuse and neglect division of the New York City Administration for Children's Services. Her father owns North American Graphics, a printing business in Manhattan. Her mother is the chairwoman of Dorot, a New York City charity that provides social services to elderly people.

The bridegroom, 25, is a vice president for investment banking at Spencer Trask & Company, a New York venture capital concern. He is also a director of the Mollie Parnis Livingston Foundation, which is named for the late dress designer and Manhattan socialite, who was a great-aunt of the bridegroom.

His mother is the chairwoman and chief executive of Carole Hochman Designs, a lingerie manufacturer in Manhattan. The bridegroom's father, who is retired, was the company's chairman and chief executive.
